titleStmt.title: Will of Heracles son of Sarapas
titleStmt.author: Heracles

msContents.summary: Latter portions of lines of the will of Heracles, son of Sarapas, leaving his property to his two sons Sarapas and Petosarapis who have to make payment to Zoilus. (Grenfell & Hunt)

msItemStruct.note: Text on the main side is 27 lines, written across the fibers. Top and bottom margins clearly visible. There are isolated markings on the lower half of the other side.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 15.1 x 28.2cm. Badly damaged papyrus, especially along the left margin. There are several large holes, resulting in loss of writing. Also, the papyrus is nearly separated horizontally in half, the result of severe fraying in the middle. The material of the top half is darker than that of the bottom.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1904, Dr. Parrish Collection).
